content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-027-24-B
|Item_parent=Prevention of foetal risks: infection, drugs, toxic substances, irradiation
|Item_parent_short=Prevention of foetal risks: infection, drugs, toxic substances, irradiation
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the risk of bacterial vaginosis during pregnancy
|Description=Risk of threatened premature delivery
|Section=Follow-up and/or prognosis
|Contributors=Alexandre Vivanti, Philippe Deruelle
|Order=24}}
Bacterial vaginosis has been suspected of favouring premature delivery. This risk is currently being called into question.

question.title: What is the relationship between bacterial vaginosis and premature delivery?
question.description: A question about the potential link between bacterial vaginosis and premature delivery

option_a.title: Bacterial vaginosis is a proven cause of premature delivery
option_a.description: A possible but not entirely accurate statement

option_b.title: Bacterial vaginosis is no longer considered a risk factor for premature delivery

option_c.title: Bacterial vaginosis is a risk factor for premature delivery, but only in certain cases

option_d.title: Bacterial vaginosis has no effect on the risk of premature delivery
option_d.description: An incorrect statement that is not supported by current knowledge

correct_option.title: C
correct_option.description: The letter of the correct option
